main event: On March 28, 1957, a civilian reported a sighting of one yellow object the size of the head of a pin at arm's length. The object was seen heading slowly south and gradually fading after thirty minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of the head of a pin at arm's length, indicating its small apparent size.
It was reported to have gradually faded over the course of thirty minutes.
Winds prevalent at the time of the sighting indicated that it could have been a released balloon from Grand Junction, Colo.
No photograph was included in the document, suggesting a lack of visual evidence to support the sighting.
The report was categorized as a 'Visual' observation by a civilian source.
